pages.title: Hazards and Travel
pages.text: There are a variety of things to see (and look out for) in the world.$(br2)This brief chapter seeks to inform the curious about what to look out for while traveling in the wilds$(br2)At the end there is a bonus section on travel preparadness!$(br2)

pages.title: Mud
pages.text: Naturally occuring in swampy or marshy areas; mud will slow down the unwary traveler.  Although not dangerous on its own; it can be a hazardous environmental condition when fighting$(br2)Since it is very dark in coloration it is also harder to see at night.  Fleeing from an undead horde is the worst time to get stuck in a mud pit.$(br2)

pages.title: Powder Snow
pages.text: In the most frigid regions of the world you may encounter Powder Snow.  This snow is light and clingy; an unwary traveler can sink right into it and start freezing.$(br2)If your vision begins to blur and turn blue (and you are up to your hips in snow); you should realize that you are in danger and should seek higher and warmer ground asap$(br2)This dangerous substance can also be carried in buckets - a fact which the devious will no doubt find uses for$(br)

pages.title: Sweet Berry Bushes
pages.text: These thorny bushes are typically encountered in boreal forests such as Taiga.  The berries are delicious however the bushes themselves are a hazard.$(br2)Sweet Berry Bushes will slow and impede movement - making even jumping out of them an impossibility.  In addition their wickedly sharp thorns will lacerate anything unfortunate enough to pass through them$(br2)

pages.title: Travel Prep: Backpacks
pages.text: A Backpack (which can be worn as Chest armor or on the Back as a Curio item) is invaluable for pro-longed travel

pages.title: Travel Prep: Sleeping Bag
pages.text: A Sleeping Bag is even more critical to travel safely in the wilderness.  Attempting to navigate at night is a recipe for getting eaten by Zombies.

pages.title: Travel Prep: Bag Lunch
pages.text: A bundle makes a great Lunch Bag; it can hold up to 64 total items of 4 different types - in one slot.$(br2)Right clicking on the Bundle with an item will put an item in; right clicking the bundle with an empty mouse cursor will take something out$(br2)

pages.title: Travel Prep: Hook Launcher
pages.text: Last but not least - bringing a hook launcher (or a crossbow and some rope arrows) can really get you out of a bind$(br2)
